answers.answer: If you or the baby are in danger yes.

No that's still too early for baby to come. Unless there's a medical issue that makes it dangerous to remain pregnant your dr won't induce before 40 weeks. I know it seriously ***** and by the end youre just so done being pregnant but you have to think about what's best for the baby
I have major swelling and semi high blood pressure.
If your doctor thinks its necessary then she will induce you, both for your safety and the baby's. If youre worried about it ask at your next appointment, worst she could say is no

I have severe edema, marginally high blood pressure, gestational diabetes, ketones in my urine, and baby is measuring more than two weeks ahead. I'm 36 weeks and we aren't even discussing induction. There's no way a doctor will induce you at 35 weeks unless your life or your baby's life is in danger.The brain of a baby born at 35 weeks weighs only 2/3 as much as the brain of a baby born at 39 weeks. The last month is very very important.
It not safe baby lungs still not developed all the way it will be better to wait to be a least 37 week that the baby it full term u don't want the baby to stay in the hospital for 1 or 2 week

question: Can they induce me at 35 weeks??
title: 34 weeks 5 days.
